topic.title: Competitor-Based Pricing
topic.p: Competitor-Based Pricing is a method that utilizes competitor prices as a benchmark. You can use competitor-based pricing to adjust the cost-based price. Basically, you should look at the prices of similar products/plugins to decide your own price point.

tr.td: Lack of your own pricing strategy that would take into consideration the peculiarities of your business
It might be close to what the market can reasonably sustain
There is a risk of price wars (especially when supply exceeds demand)

topic.p: To estimate the competitor-based price, consider the following questions:

list.li: Do they offer more or fewer features?
How do competitors price their products/plugins?
How does the cost-based price for my product/plugin compare with the competitorsâ€™ offers?
